original_title: New Anthoney’s Farms country’s first poultry producer to obtain FSSC 22000 certification
original_body_lines: The New Anthoney’s Farms became the first poultry producer in Sri Lanka to obtain internationally recognized FSSC 22000 certification, a release said.Neil Suraweera, CEO of New Anthoney’s Farms (Pvt) Ltd expressed his gratitude to the team, partners, and customers for their unwavering support throughout this transformative process, and that he looks forward to setting new benchmarks in the industry and continuing to provide poultry products that are of the highest standard in the market. SGS Lanka played a pivotal role for New Anthoney’s Farms in attaining this certification.

New Anthoney’s Group is no stranger in its effort in embracing ethical and sustainable practices. Last year, it was awarded the rights to use the prestigious ‘Sustainable U.S. Soy’ logo on their packaging, displaying a holistic commitment towards sourcing sustainable ingredients, making it the first in the South Asian and Sub-Saharan Africa region, and many others followed suit thereon.

New Anthoney’s Farms is the only producer in the county with the Greenhouse Gas (GHG) Verification Statement from Control Union in accordance with its ISO 14064-1:2018 standards. It also took the industry led to adopt biodegradable packaging in its chicken products since 2019. New Anthoney’s Group is only growing stronger, with various expansion in its end-to-end poultry value chain, including processed food. New Anthoney’s Group follows standards of the National Chicken Council, USA, and has GMP, HACCP, ISO 22000, local and international halal certifications.
